poem:
Title: Gambled Ventures

Sunak's financial glow wanes eclipse,
In recession's cold, iron grip.
Economic sway, a pendulum's clip,
The mighty machine submits, lurches and slips.
Our GDP, once sturdy as ships,
Now shifts, into uncertainty it dips.
Fettered fog of quartered trips,
a 0.3 we shan't dismiss.
Britain's pulse stutters in folly's bliss,
The dawn of realignment gives our cheek a kiss.
